metadata.title: CVE-2020-16036 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in cookies in Google Chrome prior to87.0.4280.66 allowed a remote attacker to bypass cookie restrictions via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
